result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonatta Tanner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
*Huber for work.
*Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay a fine of $200 plus all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
*Defendant to provide DNA sample.
*Court Advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
*NO violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonatta Tanner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 8 months at the House of Correction with Huber for work and 5 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $200 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) AODA, treatment or program; 4) maintain employment; 5) obtain GED or HSED.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Tonatta Tanner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Tonatta Tanner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a plea and sentence date is granted by the court.  Parties are advised that effective 08-01-15 this case will be reassigned to Branch 44 Judge Konkle    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 3  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tonatta Tanner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Court is in trial.  State to provide an offer before next court date.  All motions due next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/14/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tonatta Tanner in court with Michelle Cahoon, student intern under the supervision of Francisco Araiza for attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Ron Dague for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tonatta Tanner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Dennis Murphy for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs the Court that MPD Officer did not receive a subpeona and is requesting an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Court informs both parties that if the State is unable to proceed on the next scheduled court date, case may be dismissed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any illegal drugs and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tonatta Tanner in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 2655A N. 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
